info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:31PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Idaho, east central Clearwater, southeastern Mineral and southwestern Missoula Counties through 500 PM MDT/400 PM PDT/... At 431 PM MDT/331 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 30 miles west of Victor, or 33 miles northwest of Hamilton, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lolo Pass, Lolo Hot Springs, and Powell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT/800 PM PDT/ for central and the Panhandle of Idaho...and west central Montana.
